p: To examine enzymatic activities involved in steroid metabolism, the ratios of steroid metabolites to precursors were investigated ( Figure 4C). The metabolic ratio of T to DHT, which reflects 5Î±-reductase enzymatic activity, was significantly decreased in the brains of zebrafish after exposure to PTZ compared to controls (t (10) = 3.291; p < 0.01, Figure 4A). On the other hand, this activity was increased in the brains of zebrafish exposed to PTZ following pre-treatment with GM-90432 (t (10) = 4.621; p < 0.001, Figure 4A). The metabolic ratio of T to E2, which reflects aromatase enzymatic activity, was also significantly decreased after exposure to PTZ compared to controls (t (10) = 2.917; p < 0.05, Figure 4B). However, this activity was not rescued by pretreatment with GM-90432.
